projecttitle: Access to Water and Food Production for Wichi Indian Families
project_descrip: Short: ACCESS TO WATER AND FOOD PRODUCTION FOR WICHI INDIAN FAMILIES Long: The aim of the project was to drill two 60m deep pump wells and one 30m deep hand dug well in remote areas inhabited by indigenous tribes. The water from these wells will be stored in containers and used for drinking water supply and irrigation.
shortdescription: ACCESS TO WATER AND FOOD PRODUCTION FOR WICHI INDIAN FAMILIES
longdescription: The aim of the project was to drill two 60m deep pump wells and one 30m deep hand dug well in remote areas inhabited by indigenous tribes. The water from these wells will be stored in containers and used for drinking water supply and irrigation.

projecttitle: Market Research for Vineyard Irrigation Optimization System in Argentina (SIMONA)
project_descrip: Short: MARKET RESEARCH FOR VINEYARD IRRIGATION OPTIMIZATION SYSTEM IN ARGENTINA (SIMONA) Long: The main goal of the project is to create a business plan for the organisation of SIMONA system in Argentina, a water management optimisationwhich will be used in agriculture (vineyards) and will be based on Wireless Sensor Network (WSN) system, which will be form by different sensors that are monitoring  life condition for plants (for example soil moisture and temperature, climatic condition).
shortdescription: MARKET RESEARCH FOR VINEYARD IRRIGATION OPTIMIZATION SYSTEM IN ARGENTINA (SIMONA)
longdescription: The main goal of the project is to create a business plan for the organisation of SIMONA system in Argentina, a water management optimisationwhich will be used in agriculture (vineyards) and will be based on Wireless Sensor Network (WSN) system, which will be form by different sensors that are monitoring  life condition for plants (for example soil moisture and temperature, climatic condition).

projecttitle: Building water-intake structure and drip irrigation system ( drop-by-drop ) for plantation of organic figs in Trebinje
project_descrip: Short: BUILDING WATER-INTAKE STRUCTURE AND DRIP IRRIGATION SYSTEM ( DROP-BY-DROP ) FOR PLANTATION OF ORGANIC FIGS IN TREBINJE Long: Assistance for an abused women association in starting an organic plantation
shortdescription: BUILDING WATER-INTAKE STRUCTURE AND DRIP IRRIGATION SYSTEM ( DROP-BY-DROP ) FOR PLANTATION OF ORGANIC FIGS IN TREBINJE
longdescription: Assistance for an abused women association in starting an organic plantation

projecttitle: Watermill as a source of renewable energy
project_descrip: Short: WATERMILL AS A SOURCE OF RENEWABLE ENERGY Long: The project consisted in the installation of solar panels on a newly reconstructed water mill in Brcko. Watermills belong to the region's traditions, but most of them were severely damaged or destroyed during the conflict in the 1990s. Thanks to the restoration of their function, local farmers can grind their grain for free. The hybrid water system and solar energy make this water mill completely sustainable and the excess energy will be used to irrigate the field in dry periods. During the first few months after its opening, this mill attracted many interested people from the ranks of local farmers, but also politicians at the local and higher level, the international community and the diaspora.
shortdescription: WATERMILL AS A SOURCE OF RENEWABLE ENERGY
longdescription: The project consisted in the installation of solar panels on a newly reconstructed water mill in Brcko. Watermills belong to the region's traditions, but most of them were severely damaged or destroyed during the conflict in the 1990s. Thanks to the restoration of their function, local farmers can grind their grain for free. The hybrid water system and solar energy make this water mill completely sustainable and the excess energy will be used to irrigate the field in dry periods. During the first few months after its opening, this mill attracted many interested people from the ranks of local farmers, but also politicians at the local and higher level, the international community and the diaspora.

projecttitle: Renewable Energy Sources in Rural Development - RURAL POWER UP!
project_descrip: Short: RENEWABLE ENERGY SOURCES IN RURAL DEVELOPMENT - RURAL POWER UP! Long: Project RURAL POWER UP! contributes to the development of renewable energy sources and better use of natural resources (irrigation water) in order to improve employment, social inclusion and the future provision of ongoing educational activities. The entire system implemented at Domestica will be used as a kind of Showroom and to promote modern renewable energy solutions and enable the transfer of knowledge and experience to other stakeholders.
shortdescription: RENEWABLE ENERGY SOURCES IN RURAL DEVELOPMENT - RURAL POWER UP!
purposename: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies
geography: Krnete village, Laktasi municipality and wider Banja Luka region
longdescription: Project RURAL POWER UP! contributes to the development of renewable energy sources and better use of natural resources (irrigation water) in order to improve employment, social inclusion and the future provision of ongoing educational activities. The entire system implemented at Domestica will be used as a kind of Showroom and to promote modern renewable energy solutions and enable the transfer of knowledge and experience to other stakeholders.

projecttitle: Climate Change Adaptive Agriculture (CCAA)
project_descrip: Short: CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTIVE AGRICULTURE (CCAA) Long: The project (with MoU between MFA and Diaconia 2018-20) has reached diverse groups of inhabitants of Phnum Kravanh district, who have been directly affected by frequent floods and droughts over the past decade, in order to increase their resilience against these natural hazards. During the period Jan 2019 – Dec 2019 several prolonged droughts have affected directly the agricultural production of beneficiaries. There was a lack of water for vegetable growing and replanting – the community ponds were dried up and wells had shallow level of water during the dry season. The target households (HHs) had to dedicate their time to collecting water further away from their home or buying the water from private sellers which directly affected their livelihood and income generation. The project has been tackling this issue with water harvesting devices (water tanks for water storage in rainy season to be used in dry season) and through building of capacity of ID Poor I and II HHs in agricultural resilient techniques (using less water and resilient crops). Additionally, two community ponds have been constructed to store water (daily consumption, irrigation). The key results accomplished during the reporting period included:1.24 Youth Group members who have been trained in DRR/CCA used their knowledge and facilitation skills to provide awareness raising of DRR/CCA concept and preparedness activities to 5 target schools and 14 villages. These trainings were coordinated with school directors and teachers who have developed the DRR plan at school level,2.573 school children (303 girls) from 5 target schools and 388 community members (262 females, 7 PWDs) were provided with awareness raisings in DRR/CCA. 52 youth members were further trained in DRR/CCA concepts by the 24 youth groups members. 3.156 Target ID Poor I and II household members which have been trained in crop resilient technologies and chicken raising, are able to apply their knowledge and skills after the training in their agriculture production such as drip irrigation system, vegetable growing, natural fertilizer making, chicken feeding, chicken cage building and vaccination,4.55 HHs benefitted from water harvesting means distribution,5.26 HHs were chosen and supported as a role models to present on 3 200 m2 of land the climate change resilient agriculture techniques,6.Facilitated CCDMs and Schools Directors conducted regular quarterly meeting on disaster issues happening in each target commune and schools, 7.342 community members (173 females, 2 PWDs) participated in Farmers Forum and Water Sanitation Day,8.194 community members (83 females) can use water from 2 constructed community ponds for irrigation and daily chores purposes, especially in dry season,9.50 HHs benefitted from solar panel distribution, 10.550 community members (275 females) benefitted from organized Forestry Day.
shortdescription: CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTIVE AGRICULTURE (CCAA)
longdescription: The project (with MoU between MFA and Diaconia 2018-20) has reached diverse groups of inhabitants of Phnum Kravanh district, who have been directly affected by frequent floods and droughts over the past decade, in order to increase their resilience against these natural hazards. During the period Jan 2019 – Dec 2019 several prolonged droughts have affected directly the agricultural production of beneficiaries. There was a lack of water for vegetable growing and replanting – the community ponds were dried up and wells had shallow level of water during the dry season. The target households (HHs) had to dedicate their time to collecting water further away from their home or buying the water from private sellers which directly affected their livelihood and income generation. The project has been tackling this issue with water harvesting devices (water tanks for water storage in rainy season to be used in dry season) and through building of capacity of ID Poor I and II HHs in agricultural resilient techniques (using less water and resilient crops). Additionally, two community ponds have been constructed to store water (daily consumption, irrigation). The key results accomplished during the reporting period included:1.24 Youth Group members who have been trained in DRR/CCA used their knowledge and facilitation skills to provide awareness raising of DRR/CCA concept and preparedness activities to 5 target schools and 14 villages. These trainings were coordinated with school directors and teachers who have developed the DRR plan at school level,2.573 school children (303 girls) from 5 target schools and 388 community members (262 females, 7 PWDs) were provided with awareness raisings in DRR/CCA. 52 youth members were further trained in DRR/CCA concepts by the 24 youth groups members. 3.156 Target ID Poor I and II household members which have been trained in crop resilient technologies and chicken raising, are able to apply their knowledge and skills after the training in their agriculture production such as drip irrigation system, vegetable growing, natural fertilizer making, chicken feeding, chicken cage building and vaccination,4.55 HHs benefitted from water harvesting means distribution,5.26 HHs were chosen and supported as a role models to present on 3 200 m2 of land the climate change resilient agriculture techniques,6.Facilitated CCDMs and Schools Directors conducted regular quarterly meeting on disaster issues happening in each target commune and schools, 7.342 community members (173 females, 2 PWDs) participated in Farmers Forum and Water Sanitation Day,8.194 community members (83 females) can use water from 2 constructed community ponds for irrigation and daily chores purposes, especially in dry season,9.50 HHs benefitted from solar panel distribution, 10.550 community members (275 females) benefitted from organized Forestry Day.

projecttitle: Livelihood Enhancement Action Programme (LEAP)
project_descrip: Short: LIVELIHOOD ENHANCEMENT ACTION PROGRAMME (LEAP) Long: Main activities include capacity building in various sectors: entrepreneurship, financial management, sale and marketing skills, growing climate resilient crops and using such technology. Besides technical support, the project also provides start-up materials, development of marketing materials, support of the community infrastructure and irrigation systems, and green energy support.
shortdescription: LIVELIHOOD ENHANCEMENT ACTION PROGRAMME (LEAP)
channelreportedname: Diaconia - Evangelical Church of Czech Brethren (DECCB)
longdescription: Main activities include capacity building in various sectors: entrepreneurship, financial management, sale and marketing skills, growing climate resilient crops and using such technology. Besides technical support, the project also provides start-up materials, development of marketing materials, support of the community infrastructure and irrigation systems, and green energy support.

projecttitle: Services for the sustainable use of water and Nutrients in The Agricultural systems in Colombia – a survey of the market
project_descrip: Short: SERVICES FOR THE SUSTAINABLE USE OF WATER AND NUTRIENTS IN THE AGRICULTURAL SYSTEMS IN COLOMBIA – A SURVEY OF THE MARKET Long: The aim of the project was to prepare a business plan for the introduction of a system for optimizing agricultural water and nutrient management (with a possible focus on the production of flowers, cocoa, fruit and avocados). This system is based on a system consisting of various sensors that comprehensively monitor the living conditions of plants combined with Copernicus satellite data. Application in practice should improve the agricultural system, the availability of water for irrigation on farms with fruit, cocoa, avocados and flowers in Colombia and, following these steps, also improve the living conditions of the local population.
shortdescription: SERVICES FOR THE SUSTAINABLE USE OF WATER AND NUTRIENTS IN THE AGRICULTURAL SYSTEMS IN COLOMBIA – A SURVEY OF THE MARKET
longdescription: The aim of the project was to prepare a business plan for the introduction of a system for optimizing agricultural water and nutrient management (with a possible focus on the production of flowers, cocoa, fruit and avocados). This system is based on a system consisting of various sensors that comprehensively monitor the living conditions of plants combined with Copernicus satellite data. Application in practice should improve the agricultural system, the availability of water for irrigation on farms with fruit, cocoa, avocados and flowers in Colombia and, following these steps, also improve the living conditions of the local population.

projecttitle: Increase the agricultural producion at the El Retiro Farm of the CCRD-C
project_descrip: Short: INCREASE THE AGRICULTURAL PRODUCION AT THE EL RETIRO FARM OF THE CCRD-C Long: The project was aimed at increasing the agricultural production of the organic farm El Retiro, which was established by CCRD-C in 1998 and is recognized by local authorities. Although the city of Cardenas is one of the most populous, largest and economically important cities in the province of Matanzas, its agricultural production barely covers 22% of the demand of its inhabitants, organisations and institutions. The El Retiro organic farm has long focused on the production of fresh and preserved food and targets the most vulnerable members of the local community (old people's homes, disabled people, pregnant women, students), to whom food is supplied through CCRD-C. The farm is 33 hectares in size and its potential is currently underutilized due to a lack of agricultural tools and equipment, outdated irrigation systems, and a lack of shaded areas that would allow for a more voluminous and sustained harvest throughout the year. In addition to the purchase of agricultural tools, seeds and seedlings, animal feed, the construction of fencing, the installation of irrigation systems and the roofing of farmland, the project also envisaged the transfer of knowledge and experience through theoretical and practical workshops aimed at small-scale private farmers and members of agricultural cooperatives. The project has not only ensured greater and more diversified production of agricultural products and the associated improved nutrition of vulnerable groups, but has also increased the productivity of the farm workers themselves and their motivation.
shortdescription: INCREASE THE AGRICULTURAL PRODUCION AT THE EL RETIRO FARM OF THE CCRD-C
channelreportedname: Christian Center for Reflection and Dialogue-Cuba (CCRD-C)
longdescription: The project was aimed at increasing the agricultural production of the organic farm El Retiro, which was established by CCRD-C in 1998 and is recognized by local authorities. Although the city of Cardenas is one of the most populous, largest and economically important cities in the province of Matanzas, its agricultural production barely covers 22% of the demand of its inhabitants, organisations and institutions. The El Retiro organic farm has long focused on the production of fresh and preserved food and targets the most vulnerable members of the local community (old people's homes, disabled people, pregnant women, students), to whom food is supplied through CCRD-C. The farm is 33 hectares in size and its potential is currently underutilized due to a lack of agricultural tools and equipment, outdated irrigation systems, and a lack of shaded areas that would allow for a more voluminous and sustained harvest throughout the year. In addition to the purchase of agricultural tools, seeds and seedlings, animal feed, the construction of fencing, the installation of irrigation systems and the roofing of farmland, the project also envisaged the transfer of knowledge and experience through theoretical and practical workshops aimed at small-scale private farmers and members of agricultural cooperatives. The project has not only ensured greater and more diversified production of agricultural products and the associated improved nutrition of vulnerable groups, but has also increased the productivity of the farm workers themselves and their motivation.

projecttitle: Solar powered water pumps for the development of rural areas
project_descrip: Short: SOLAR POWERED WATER PUMPS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF RURAL AREAS Long: The project aims to increase economic and social development in the rural/remote areas of Ghana. Solar water pumps are going to be used as a safe and reliable source of energy for drinking water pumping, which will secure an easier and cheaper access to safe drinking water. They will be also used as an energy source for irrigation for subsistence farmers, who are fully dependant on agriculture.
shortdescription: SOLAR POWERED WATER PUMPS FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF RURAL AREAS
longdescription: The project aims to increase economic and social development in the rural/remote areas of Ghana. Solar water pumps are going to be used as a safe and reliable source of energy for drinking water pumping, which will secure an easier and cheaper access to safe drinking water. They will be also used as an energy source for irrigation for subsistence farmers, who are fully dependant on agriculture.

projecttitle: Building Resilience of Conflict Affected Communities in Nineveh through Revitalization of Livelihood Opportunities and Restoration of Food Security
project_descrip: Short: BUILDING RESILIENCE OF CONFLICT AFFECTED COMMUNITIES IN NINEVEH THROUGH REVITALIZATION OF LIVELIHOOD OPPORTUNITIES AND RESTORATION OF FOOD SECURITY Long: The project concentrated on rehabilitation of key agricultural infrastructures and recovery of livelihood opportunities with the aim of reducing food insecurity of the most vulnerable conflict-affected households in Bashiqa sub-district and increasing community resilience. People in Need (PIN) intervention targeted the recovery of livelihood assets through the rebuilding of irrigation and soil canal systems necessary to foster sustainable, self-reliant and resilient agricultural production.Rehabilitation works were designed as cash for work (CfW) activity that targeted the most vulnerable, food insecure returnee, remainee and IDP households and thereby supported their access to immediate income, which subsequently helped accommodate their basic day-to-day needs. The proposed action was closely interlinked with other PIN's activities in the area, namely the World Food Programme (WFP)-funded project, and had thus intended to build on the already existent structures further expanding their impact.
shortdescription: BUILDING RESILIENCE OF CONFLICT AFFECTED COMMUNITIES IN NINEVEH THROUGH REVITALIZATION OF LIVELIHOOD OPPORTUNITIES AND RESTORATION OF FOOD SECURITY
longdescription: The project concentrated on rehabilitation of key agricultural infrastructures and recovery of livelihood opportunities with the aim of reducing food insecurity of the most vulnerable conflict-affected households in Bashiqa sub-district and increasing community resilience. People in Need (PIN) intervention targeted the recovery of livelihood assets through the rebuilding of irrigation and soil canal systems necessary to foster sustainable, self-reliant and resilient agricultural production.Rehabilitation works were designed as cash for work (CfW) activity that targeted the most vulnerable, food insecure returnee, remainee and IDP households and thereby supported their access to immediate income, which subsequently helped accommodate their basic day-to-day needs. The proposed action was closely interlinked with other PIN's activities in the area, namely the World Food Programme (WFP)-funded project, and had thus intended to build on the already existent structures further expanding their impact.

projecttitle: Conceptual design of a  water source of drinking and irrigation water in the Khornawazan Valley
project_descrip: Short: CONCEPTUAL DESIGN OF A  WATER SOURCE OF DRINKING AND IRRIGATION WATER IN THE KHORNAWAZAN VALLEY Long: The aim of the project was to process and assess the possibilities of water management in a selected locality, especially in the area of sources of drinking and irrigation water. Their lack threatens the lives of local people and negatively affects their socio-economic conditions and opportunities.

projecttitle: Rehabilitation of the Derbendikhan Dam protection barrier, Sulayimania Governote, IRAQ
project_descrip: Short: REHABILITATION OF THE DERBENDIKHAN DAM PROTECTION BARRIER, SULAYIMANIA GOVERNOTE, IRAQ Long: The main aim of the project is the formulation of a feasibility study for the rehabilitation of a damaged and non-functioning safety barriers of the Derbendikhan dam built in 1980s. The dam is currently not functioning, and in regards to the political situation in the country, unsatisfactory. By repairing the dam, safe operationability will be achieved which will lead to rejuvenation of its purposes - irrigation and drinking water, the production of electric energy, fishing and recreation.
shortdescription: REHABILITATION OF THE DERBENDIKHAN DAM PROTECTION BARRIER, SULAYIMANIA GOVERNOTE, IRAQ
longdescription: The main aim of the project is the formulation of a feasibility study for the rehabilitation of a damaged and non-functioning safety barriers of the Derbendikhan dam built in 1980s. The dam is currently not functioning, and in regards to the political situation in the country, unsatisfactory. By repairing the dam, safe operationability will be achieved which will lead to rejuvenation of its purposes - irrigation and drinking water, the production of electric energy, fishing and recreation.

projecttitle: Inhaca Island small-scale farming and drip irrigation project
project_descrip: Short: INHACA ISLAND SMALL-SCALE FARMING AND DRIP IRRIGATION PROJECT Long: The project consisted of practical training to properly care for, land, plant, plant and grow vegetables, including the provision of advanced technology to carry out agricultural activities on the island of Inhaca, which is part of the Maputo capital. Part of the project was also a link to a network of local dealers, who will continue to produce the produced produce at Maputo markets. The local community and schools were involved in the training so that students understand the whole cropping cycle. The project significantly supported the unemployed women of the island, provided a livelihood and a comprehensive range of activities leading to their independence.
shortdescription: INHACA ISLAND SMALL-SCALE FARMING AND DRIP IRRIGATION PROJECT
longdescription: The project consisted of practical training to properly care for, land, plant, plant and grow vegetables, including the provision of advanced technology to carry out agricultural activities on the island of Inhaca, which is part of the Maputo capital. Part of the project was also a link to a network of local dealers, who will continue to produce the produced produce at Maputo markets. The local community and schools were involved in the training so that students understand the whole cropping cycle. The project significantly supported the unemployed women of the island, provided a livelihood and a comprehensive range of activities leading to their independence.

projecttitle: Transfer of EMSF desalination technology to Mozambique
project_descrip: Short: TRANSFER OF EMSF DESALINATION TECHNOLOGY TO MOZAMBIQUE Long: Objective of this project is a transfer of unique Environmental Multi-Stage Flesh (EMSF) technology to Mozambique which is extremely vulnerable in regard of water supply for drinking as well as irrigation purposes. The feasibility study intends to verify the suitability of EMSF technology in local conditions and prepare the ground for installation of 2 EMSF units during the implementation stage.
shortdescription: TRANSFER OF EMSF DESALINATION TECHNOLOGY TO MOZAMBIQUE
longdescription: Objective of this project is a transfer of unique Environmental Multi-Stage Flesh (EMSF) technology to Mozambique which is extremely vulnerable in regard of water supply for drinking as well as irrigation purposes. The feasibility study intends to verify the suitability of EMSF technology in local conditions and prepare the ground for installation of 2 EMSF units during the implementation stage.

projecttitle: Water Management, To Eradicate Poverty and Improve Agriculture Out Put
project_descrip: Short: WATER MANAGEMENT, TO ERADICATE POVERTY AND IMPROVE AGRICULTURE OUT PUT Long: Thanks to this project, an irrigation canal was built in the village of Shobar Khel, which is a significant help for local farmers struggling with water scarcity, but ultimately also for the whole village. Thanks to the implementation of the project, the management of limited water resources in the area has become significantly more efficient, and thus the agricultural land has been expanded and the yield has been significantly increased. This then contributes to improving the livelihoods of the local population, simplifying the labor intensity of agriculture, and thus reducing the use of child labor, the overall development of the village and, last but not least, reducing water conflicts.
shortdescription: WATER MANAGEMENT, TO ERADICATE POVERTY AND IMPROVE AGRICULTURE OUT PUT
longdescription: Thanks to this project, an irrigation canal was built in the village of Shobar Khel, which is a significant help for local farmers struggling with water scarcity, but ultimately also for the whole village. Thanks to the implementation of the project, the management of limited water resources in the area has become significantly more efficient, and thus the agricultural land has been expanded and the yield has been significantly increased. This then contributes to improving the livelihoods of the local population, simplifying the labor intensity of agriculture, and thus reducing the use of child labor, the overall development of the village and, last but not least, reducing water conflicts.

projecttitle: Project of ecological irrigation of agricultural crops using solar energy
project_descrip: Short: PROJECT OF ECOLOGICAL IRRIGATION OF AGRICULTURAL CROPS USING SOLAR ENERGY Long: The pilot project consists in preparation of technical documentation allowing the construction of 1 pumping modular mobile station with a two pumps designed to irrigate 2000 ha area. Irrigation technology will be tailor-made according to specific local conditions and current needs of the crops in order to support the idea of organic food production without the use of artificial fertilizers and chemicals

projecttitle: Gogo Gardens and Horticultural Watering Systems
project_descrip: Short: GOGO GARDENS AND HORTICULTURAL WATERING SYSTEMS Long: The project will significantly improve the food security and self-sufficiency of communities affected by the AIDS / HIV epidemic in the eThekwini region, KwaZulu-Natal province, while contributing to the skills of the poorest. Installation of a total of 13 fenced gardens, which were equipped with irrigation equipment and training of their users. Installation of automated watering system and toilets was also included.

channelname: Other public entities in recipient country

Installation of a total of 13 fenced gardens, which were equipped with irrigation equipment and training of their users. Installation of automated watering system and toilets was also included.

projecttitle: Feasibiltiy study of waste water treatment plan for the Hazzah district, East Ghouta, SyriaHazzah, vychodni Ghuta, Syrie
project_descrip: Short: FEASIBILTIY STUDY OF WASTE WATER TREATMENT PLAN FOR THE HAZZAH DISTRICT, EAST GHOUTA, SYRIAHAZZAH, VYCHODNI GHUTA, SYRIE Long: The aim is to assess and conceptualize solutions in regards to waste water management in Hazzah, Syria. The treated waste water can be used in housing duties such as irrigation, cleaning, toilet use. The devastation of water sources caused the lack of water in the region, contamination of environment and long-term sewage water issues. The project aims at solving these problems caused by the war conflict.
shortdescription: FEASIBILTIY STUDY OF WASTE WATER TREATMENT PLAN FOR THE HAZZAH DISTRICT, EAST GHOUTA, SYRIAHAZZAH, VYCHODNI GHUTA, SYRIE

The devastation of water sources caused the lack of water in the region, contamination of environment and long-term sewage water issues. The project aims at solving these problems caused by the war conflict.

projecttitle: Restoration of war-torn irrigation systems in Latakia and Tartus
project_descrip: Short: RESTORATION OF WAR-TORN IRRIGATION SYSTEMS IN LATAKIA AND TARTUS Long: The aim of the project is to develop an analysis of the reconstruction of the war-damaged irrigation infrastructure in Latakia and Tartus. The analysis should describe the quality and quantity of groundwater and surface water and the existing ways of using it, and identify the weaknesses in relation to the development plan, which is to improve the quality of life in the area.

longdescription: The aim of the project is to develop an analysis of the reconstruction of the war-damaged irrigation infrastructure in Latakia and Tartus. The analysis should describe the quality and quantity of groundwater and surface water and the existing ways of using it, and identify the weaknesses in relation to the development plan, which is to improve the quality of life in the area.

projecttitle: Feasibility Study - Solving Water Problems by Using Czech Water Treatment Plants / Water Treatment Plants
project_descrip: Short: FEASIBILITY STUDY - SOLVING WATER PROBLEMS BY USING CZECH WATER TREATMENT PLANTS / WATER TREATMENT PLANTS Long: The proposed project aims to elaborate a feasibility study/ studies in the discipline of water and wastewater treatment on small/local scale. The feasibility study would propose suitable technical solution(s) for the treatment of grey water in the schools. The recycled grey water would secure supply of suitable, sterilised water fit for the irrigation of the targeted school gardens.

longdescription: The proposed project aims to elaborate a feasibility study/ studies in the discipline of water and wastewater treatment on small/local scale. The feasibility study would propose suitable technical solution(s) for the treatment of grey water in the schools. The recycled grey water would secure supply of suitable, sterilised water fit for the irrigation of the targeted school gardens.

projecttitle: Wastewater Treatment Technologies Transfer for Sustainable Farming and Forestry Systems (WaTECH)
project_descrip: Short: WASTEWATER TREATMENT TECHNOLOGIES TRANSFER FOR SUSTAINABLE FARMING AND FORESTRY SYSTEMS (WATECH) Long: The WaTECH project was created in connection with the nationwide seminar Waste Recovery with the aim of introducing the Czech technology to the widest professional public. Tertiary wastewater treatment gained attention, as Tunisia faces considerable hydric stress for most of the year. The technology of mechanical tertiary wastewater treatment with a sieve filter is new and extremely necessary for Tunisia. As part of the project, a mechanical strainer was selected and imported into Tunisia. However, the lock down associated with COVID -19 slowed down the implementation of the project to such an extent that it was not possible to experimentally verify the parameters of treated wastewater by chemical and biological analysis of samples before and after filtration, because periods of heavy torrential rains diluted the pool water supply at the filter entrance. that the samples for subsequent analysis would be meaningless and the experimental part must be carried out only during the hot months of 2021, when agricultural crops are irrigated. Tertiary filtration will help GDA farmers in Sidi Amor deal with irrigation and at the same time create a reference for the subsequent acquisition of filters by Tunisian agricultural regions interested in the technology of using purified water for irrigation.
shortdescription: WASTEWATER TREATMENT TECHNOLOGIES TRANSFER FOR SUSTAINABLE FARMING AND FORESTRY SYSTEMS (WATECH)
longdescription: The WaTECH project was created in connection with the nationwide seminar Waste Recovery with the aim of introducing the Czech technology to the widest professional public. Tertiary wastewater treatment gained attention, as Tunisia faces considerable hydric stress for most of the year. The technology of mechanical tertiary wastewater treatment with a sieve filter is new and extremely necessary for Tunisia. As part of the project, a mechanical strainer was selected and imported into Tunisia. However, the lock down associated with COVID -19 slowed down the implementation of the project to such an extent that it was not possible to experimentally verify the parameters of treated wastewater by chemical and biological analysis of samples before and after filtration, because periods of heavy torrential rains diluted the pool water supply at the filter entrance. that the samples for subsequent analysis would be meaningless and the experimental part must be carried out only during the hot months of 2021, when agricultural crops are irrigated. Tertiary filtration will help GDA farmers in Sidi Amor deal with irrigation and at the same time create a reference for the subsequent acquisition of filters by Tunisian agricultural regions interested in the technology of using purified water for irrigation.

projecttitle: Situtu Primary School Classroom Block Construction Project
project_descrip: Short: SITUTU PRIMARY SCHOOL CLASSROOM BLOCK CONSTRUCTION PROJECT Long: The aim of the project was to build a school in the city of Situtu in the district of Nkeyema District, Western Province - classrooms, cabinet and toilets. The aim of the project was to replace grass and unfired brick structures, which have to be renewed very often and cannot be used during the rainy season, and thus improve access to education in one of the poorest districts in Zambia. As part of the project, there was a significant increase in the capacity of the school, the new building meets, among other things, the standards for holding the final exams, which students have so far had to pass in a neighboring town, and hygienic conditions have improved. At the initiative of the Embassy, the school also installed gutters and a rainwater collection tank in addition to the project, which will henceforth be used mainly for irrigating the school garden.
shortdescription: SITUTU PRIMARY SCHOOL CLASSROOM BLOCK CONSTRUCTION PROJECT
longdescription: The aim of the project was to build a school in the city of Situtu in the district of Nkeyema District, Western Province - classrooms, cabinet and toilets. The aim of the project was to replace grass and unfired brick structures, which have to be renewed very often and cannot be used during the rainy season, and thus improve access to education in one of the poorest districts in Zambia. As part of the project, there was a significant increase in the capacity of the school, the new building meets, among other things, the standards for holding the final exams, which students have so far had to pass in a neighboring town, and hygienic conditions have improved. At the initiative of the Embassy, the school also installed gutters and a rainwater collection tank in addition to the project, which will henceforth be used mainly for irrigating the school garden.

projecttitle: Situtu Primary School Water Supply Project
project_descrip: Short: SITUTU PRIMARY SCHOOL WATER SUPPLY PROJECT Long: A water well was drilled in the area of the primary school, which is still struggling with a lack of quality drinking water, and it was equipped with a solar-powered pump. The water was also distributed to the surrounding community and to the school garden, where an irrigation system was built. The garden was fenced and the school was provided with seeds, seedlings and basic agricultural implements. In addition to the source of water, the school also had the opportunity to grow fruits and vegetables, which will be used to diversify the diet of students and as an additional source of income for further development of the school.
